title: Newsprint and Laser Printer
content:
Hi

I have a pretty big problem. I need to find a stock that feels/looks like newsprint but can be sent through a laser printer. If anyone had any experience like this, or if you know of any paper stocks that simulate newsprint please let me know.

Thanks!
author: tannenhauser

comments.content:
[http://www.mrfrench.com/results.asp?image=3549](http://web.archive.org/web/20090621073721/http:/www.mrfrench.com/results.asp?image=3549 "http://www.mrfrench.com/results.asp?image=3549")

There’s a newsprint white, but it is still pretty dark. Not really like newsprint though.

I have tried sending regular newsprint paper through a small office photocopier, basically the same printing technology as a laser printer, and found that the toner won’t stick tightly to the smooth surface. This was useful for a certain transfer technique, but not for general purposes. Fortunately it didn’t jam the feed mechanisms, but I feared it would because of its light weight and limp body. I have not tried rough surfaced newsprint (such as that in artists pads), though I suspect the loose fiber in the surface might cause other problems.
yeah... the french paper co is the paper i have now. my problem with it is that its “pretty” and not cheap looking.

As a former seven-year Kinko’s vet., I would suggest finding a small Canon copier with a by-pass tray. Those little copiers were amazing with the types of paper that would work! I tried everything from handmade paper to tissue paper. Viola! The hard part will be to first find one and two your stock size. The copiers I am referring to had an 8.5 inx 14 in max sheet size.
